labelById.355939: 2: The Influence of Language and Culture on Identity
labelById.355941: 4: How Science and Technology Affect Our Lives
labelById.355942: 5: Factors That Impact the Quality of Life
labelById.355764: Skill Category 1: Comprehend written, audio, audiovisual, and visual text (text and pictures).
labelById.355765: Skill 1.A: Describe the literal meaning of the text.
labelById.355769: Skill Category 2: Make cultural and interdisciplinary connections.
labelById.355770: Skill 2.A: Make connections among cultural and interdisciplinary information provided in texts.
labelById.355771: 2.A.1: Determine or infer the meaning of a text using provided cultural and/or interdisciplinary information.
labelById.355772: 2.A.2: Explain how information from a text connects or relates to the target culture or interdisciplinary phenomena.
labelById.355773: 2.A.3: Describe content and connections among cultural and interdisciplinary topics.
labelById.355774: Skill Category 3: Interpret the content of written or audio text (words).
labelById.355775: Skill 3.A: Interpret the distinguishing features of a text.
labelById.355778: 3.A.3: Identify and/or describe the point(s) of view, perspective(s), tone, or attitude.
labelById.355779: Skill 3.B: Interpret the meanings of a text.
labelById.355782: Skill Category 4: Make meanings from words and expressions.
labelById.355783: Skill 4.A: Determine the meaning of familiar and unfamiliar words.
labelById.355784: 4.A.1: Determine the meaning of a variety of vocabulary.
labelById.355786: Skill 4.B: Use words appropriate for a given context.
labelById.355787: 4.B.1: Use a variety of vocabulary in written and spoken communication.
labelById.355788: 4.B.2: Explain or use idiomatic and culturally authentic expressions.
labelById.355789: Skill Category 5: Communicate interpersonally by speaking with others.
labelById.355790: Skill 5.A: Understand and apply appropriate communication strategies in interpersonal speaking.
labelById.355791: 5.A.1: Initiate, maintain, and close spoken exchanges.
labelById.355792: 5.A.2: Comprehend an interlocutor's message in spoken exchanges.
labelById.355793: 5.A.3: Provide and obtain relevant information in spoken exchanges.
labelById.355794: 5.A.4: Use appropriate register and greeting for the intended target culture audience in spoken exchanges.
labelById.355795: 5.A.5: Use pronunciation and pitch that are comprehensible when interacting with speakers of the target language in spoken exchanges.
labelById.355796: 5.A.6: Use effective intonation patterns, pacing, and delivery when interacting with speakers of the target language in spoken exchanges.
labelById.355797: 5.A.7: Use communication strategies such as circumlocution, requesting clarification, asking for repetition, and paraphrasing to maintain spoken exchanges.
labelById.355798: Skill 5.B: Understand and apply appropriate and varied syntactical expressions in interpersonal speaking.
labelById.355799: 5.B.1: Use a variety of grammar and syntax in spoken exchanges.
labelById.355800: 5.B.2: Use transitional expressions and cohesive devices in spoken exchanges.
labelById.355801: 5.B.3: Comprehend and produce simple, compound, and complex sentences in a variety of time frames in spoken exchanges.
labelById.355802: 5.B.4: Monitor language production; recognize errors and attempt self-correction in spoken exchanges.
labelById.355803: Skill Category 6: Communicate interpersonally by writing to others.
labelById.355804: Skill 6.A: Understand and apply appropriate communication strategies in interpersonal writing.
labelById.355805: 6.A.1: Initiate, maintain, and close written exchanges.
labelById.355806: 6.A.2: Provide and obtain relevant information in written exchanges.
labelById.355807: 6.A.3: Provide suggestions, ideas, and/or opinions with supporting details and or examples in written exchanges.
labelById.355808: 6.A.4: Use a variety of grammar and syntax in written exchanges.
labelById.355809: 6.A.5: Use register appropriate for the intended target culture audience in written exchanges.
labelById.355810: 6.A.6: Use communication strategies such as circumlocution, requesting clarification, and paraphrasing to maintain written exchanges.
labelById.355811: Skill 6.B: Understand and apply appropriate and varied syntactical expressions in interpersonal writing.
labelById.355812: 6.B.1: Use transitional expressions and cohesive devices to create paragraph-length discourse in written exchanges.
labelById.355813: 6.B.2: Comprehend and produce simple, compound, and complex sentences in a variety of time frames in written exchanges.
labelById.355814: 6.B.3: Use standard conventions of the written language (e.g., orthography, punctuation) in written exchanges.
labelById.355815: 6.B.4: Monitor language production; recognize errors and attempt self-correction in written exchanges.
labelById.355816: Skill 6.C: Understand and apply appropriate writing systems in interpersonal writing.
labelById.355817: 6.C.1: Uses appropriate writing systems (hiragana, katakana, kanji) in interpersonal communication.
labelById.355818: 6.C.2: Use handwriting to communicate in written exchanges.
labelById.355819: 6.C.3: Use keyboarding to communicate in written exchanges.
labelById.355820: Skill Category 7: Communicate through spoken presentations.
labelById.355821: Skill 7.A: Plan and research an issue or topic for presentational speaking.
labelById.355822: 7.A.1: Use a process to plan spoken presentations.
labelById.355823: 7.A.2: Use research strategies to gather information and evidence for inclusion in spoken presentations.
labelById.355824: Skill 7.B: Use appropriate vocal and visual strategies to communicate an idea in presentational speaking.
labelById.355825: 7.B.1: Produce spoken presentations in the appropriate register with an introduction, development of topic, and conclusion.
labelById.355826: 7.B.2: Use transitional expressions and cohesive devices to create paragraph-length discourse in spoken presentations.
labelById.355827: 7.B.3: Use pronunciation and pitch in spoken presentations that are comprehensible to speakers of the target language.
labelById.355828: 7.B.4: Use effective intonation patterns, pacing, and delivery in spoken presentations.
labelById.355829: 7.B.5: Use communication strategies such as circumlocution and paraphrasing to maintain spoken presentations.
labelById.355830: Skill 7.C: Use appropriate language and vocabulary for your audience for presentational speaking.
labelById.355831: 7.C.1: Use a variety of grammar and syntax in spoken presentations.
labelById.355832: 7.C.2: Produce simple, compound, and complex sentences in a variety of time frames in spoken presentations.
labelById.355833: 7.C.3: Monitor language production; recognize errors and attempt self-correction in spoken presentations.
labelById.355834: Skill 7.D: Express a perspective with details and examples to illustrate an opinion or idea in presentational speaking.
labelById.355835: 7.D.1: Explain ideas and opinions with examples in spoken presentations.
labelById.355836: 7.D.2: Identify and describe features (including products, practices, and perspectives), of target cultural communities in spoken presentations.
labelById.355837: Skill Category 8: Communicate through written presentations.
labelById.355838: Skill 8.A: Plan and research an issue or topic for presentational writing.
labelById.355839: 8.A.1: Use a process to plan written presentations.
labelById.355840: 8.A.2: Use research strategies to gather information and evidence for inclusion in written presentations.
labelById.355841: Skill 8.B: Use appropriate writing strategies to communicate an idea in presentational writing.
labelById.355842: 8.B.1: Produce written presentations in the appropriate register with an introduction, development of topic, and conclusion.
labelById.355843: 8.B.2: Use communication strategies such as circumlocution and paraphrasing to maintain written presentations.
labelById.355844: Skill 8.C: Understand and apply appropriate and varied syntactical expressions in presentational writing.
labelById.355845: 8.C.1: Use transitional expressions and cohesive devices to create paragraph-length discourse in written presentations.
labelById.355846: 8.C.2: Use a variety of grammar and syntax in written presentations.
labelById.355847: 8.C.3: Produce simple, compound, and complex sentences in a variety of time frames in written presentations.
labelById.355848: 8.C.4: Use standard conventions of the written language (e.g., orthography, punctuation) in written presentations.
labelById.355849: 8.C.5: Monitor language production; recognize errors and attempt self-correction in written presentations.
labelById.355850: Skill 8.D: Express a perspective with details and examples to illustrate an opinion or idea for written presentations.
labelById.355851: 8.D.1: Explain ideas and opinions with examples in written presentations.
labelById.355852: 8.D.2: Compare features of the target language culture (including products, practices, and perspectives).
labelById.355853: Skill 8.E: Understand and apply appropriate writing systems in presentational writing.
labelById.355854: 8.E.1: Use appropriate writing systems (hiragana, katakana, kanji) in written presentations.
labelById.355855: 8.E.2: Use handwriting to communicate in written presentations.
labelById.355856: 8.E.3: Use keyboarding to communicate in written presentations.
